entries.meaning: A man who tends free-range cattle, especially in the American West.
A man who identifies with cowboy culture, including wearing a cowboy hat and being a fan of country and western music.
(informal) A person who engages in reckless behavior, especially for the purpose of showing off.
(Britain, informal) A dishonest and/or incompetent independent tradesman.
(card games, slang) A playing card of king rank.

verbs.description: cowboy (third-person singular simple present cowboys, present participle cowboying, simple past and past participle cowboyed)

entries.meaning: (intransitive) To work as a cowboy, herding cattle.
examples: Besides cowboying he worked at a small sawmill that cut logs into "four slabs and a tie" and sold ties to the railroad.
